result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Martice Garcia

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antoine Martice Garcia not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Antoine Martice Garcia.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status/scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests projected Plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Antoine Martice Garcia not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Antoine Martice Garcia in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Thomas Reed appears as a representative from the State Public Defenders Office. The State Public Defenders Office has not yet made an appointment. Court appoints Attorney Michael G. Levine at County expense.   

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Flaherty notified Court that there is a global resolution pending with defendant's other case. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Parties contact to move hearing on 6-8-2022 to 8:30 am due to jury trial week for Branch 4.

Defendant Antoine Martice Garcia not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; 24 hour curfew.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $75,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Antoine Martice Garcia in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Antoine Martice Garcia in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antoine Martice Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Khalil M.I.; Mazen N.M.; Hassan M.M.; Kileen M.P.; Mary C.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
